summary: ReCloned: Clone Wars Rewatch Podcast Episode 023
title: ReCloned: Clone Wars Rewatch Podcast Episode 023
body:
Our hosts watch Season 1 Episode 18, Mystery of a Thousand Moons with returning special guest Felicia! They talk about about whether we’re supposed to root for Anakin and Padme as well as whether Taquito is a good Star Wars name. Onto this week’s adventures in Clone Wars!


Check out the new episode of ReCloned!

Check out the new episode of ReCloned!

Check out the new episode of ReCloned!

summary: Captain friendly here likes to talk... a lot... and by the time you reach your destination you will know every possible thing...
caption: Captain friendly here likes to talk… a lot… and by the time you reach your destination you will know every possible thing about him, his uncle Steve, his dog, his favorite restaurant down on 34th street next to the creepy tattoo parlor with the off putting slogan, and his pile of kids and and their accompanying homework waiting at home for him. You’ll enjoy every second of it…

blog.description: I am a descriptivist linguist for the Mando'a language. I show what it can do, not what it MUST do. This is a place for discussion about Mando'a, and Mandalorian society and culture. Feel free to use the head cannons from this blog (or reblogged from others) in your RP or writing. All words and descriptions are taken from the mandoa.org Mandalorian Dictionary. Want to support this blog? Buy me a Kofi? OR buy some Mando'a themed items? Visit our Discord? Blog icon by Rina

blog.name: princessamericachavez
blog.title: Your Ticket to the Multiverse
blog.description: Mexican 24. Journalist, writer, geek. Currently majoring in creative writing. She/Her.

summary: I call that edgelord 'Ben' fpr the same reason Dumbledore calls Voldemort 'Tom': I refuse to let him redefine reality. He's not...
question: I call that edgelord 'Ben' fpr the same reason Dumbledore calls Voldemort 'Tom': I refuse to let him redefine reality. He's not a Kylo-anything - he's Leia and Han's son, he murdered his dad in cold blood, attempted to kill his mother and is an all-round shithead. So.
answer:
While I appreciate the sentiment, I think you’re still going about this the wrong way. Here’s the thing: you’re mixing up two completely different lores and backstories, and they don’t exactly match up. 

Tom Riddle chose the name Voldemort for himself without prompting, not because he was joining some sect (that didn’t previously exist at all) but because he felt the name made him superior somehow and he knew he could use it to terrorize people. He chose a name that would become a synonym with evil and massacre, one that was even cursed to become a bad omen and mess with the resistance’s spells in the last book. By refusing to call him that chosen name, the characters denied him the satisfaction of having the effect he wanted on them. They took that power away.

Ben Solo, on the other hand, chose the name Kylo-Ren not as an intimidation tactic but as a new identity within a fascist organization. The name wasn’t picked to cause fear or mystery around himself, its purpose was to signal himself as part of the First Order and separate himself from the persona his parents and friends had loved. Erasing that name would not have the Voldemort effect for him or the characters around him. It would be the equivalent of unlinking him from the horrors he has committed and the very important fact that he chose to be part of those actions. 

TL;DR: While both Harry Potter and Star Wars acknowledge that names are powerful, each story handles it completely differently. Harry Potter acknowledges that there’s power in made-up names that give evil people a grand legend-like status. Star Wars, ever since Darth Vader, sees names as much more linked to the person’s identity, and therefore signifies that choosing a Sith name implies the death of your previous persona and the embracing of the new evil one.

Tom Riddle chose the name Voldemort for himself without prompting, not because he was joining some sect (that didn’t previously exist at all) but because he felt the name made him superior somehow and he knew he could use it to terrorize people. Star Wars, ever since Darth Vader, sees names as much more linked to the person’s identity, and therefore signifies that choosing a Sith name implies the death of your previous persona and the embracing of the new evil one.
trail.content:
While I appreciate the sentiment, I think you’re still going about this the wrong way. Here’s the thing: you’re mixing up two completely different lores and backstories, and they don’t exactly match up. 

Tom Riddle chose the name Voldemort for himself without prompting, not because he was joining some sect (that didn’t previously exist at all) but because he felt the name made him superior somehow and he knew he could use it to terrorize people. He chose a name that would become a synonym with evil and massacre, one that was even cursed to become a bad omen and mess with the resistance’s spells in the last book. By refusing to call him that chosen name, the characters denied him the satisfaction of having the effect he wanted on them. They took that power away.

The name wasn’t picked to cause fear or mystery around himself, its purpose was to signal himself as part of the First Order and separate himself from the persona his parents and friends had loved. Erasing that name would not have the Voldemort effect for him or the characters around him. It would be the equivalent of unlinking him from the horrors he has committed and the very important fact that he chose to be part of those actions.

Harry Potter acknowledges that there’s power in made-up names that give evil people a grand legend-like status. An AO3 Feed for the Star Wars - All Media Types tag.

Icon from the Star Wars App.

summary: Mistletoe Madness
title: Mistletoe Madness
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2DpybOt

by AmberDread

Written for The Writing Den prompt challenge.

The Mistletoe started this madness…

It seems like the only time Rey is taken out, it is as a friendly plus-one to her brother or her friends.
Then one night, she (literally) bumps into a man that makes her heart flutter in her chest. Too bad it’s Mr. Solo, her brother’s horrible boss.
Then she is introduced to Mr. Hux, and it all goes downhill from there.

Told through multiple POV’s, but Rey is the main protagonist.

Yes, yes, I know it’s nowhere near Christmas, I blame prompt number 6.

Words: 10518, Chapters: ½, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Star Wars - All Media Types
  • Rating: Not Rated
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: F/M, M/M, Multi
  • Characters: Rey (Star Wars), Armitage Hux, Ben Solo, Finn (Star Wars), Poe Dameron, Chewbacca (Star Wars), Lando Calrissian
  • Relationships: Armitage Hux/Ben Solo | Kylo Ren, Rey/Ben Solo, Armitage Hux/Rey, Armitage Hux/Rey/Ben Solo | Kylo Ren, Poe Dameron/Finn
  • Additional Tags: Alternate Universe - Modern Setting, Kylux - Freeform, Reylo - Freeform, Reyux, Reylux - Freeform, Rey is thirsty, but doesn’t know it, Until she does, So many prompts, CHRISTMAS CAME EARLY THIS YEAR, slowish burn, Slow Build, Threesome - F/M/M, three way, I went off on an tangent and then got a little lost, Transit vans are bad, I have no idea what this even is, Utter shite probably, Submissive Rey, maybe? - Freeform, Not Much Plot TBH, Second part is mostly porn, Oops, Clam!


read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2DpybOt

read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2DpybOt

Yes, yes, I know it’s nowhere near Christmas, I blame prompt number 6.
